titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Producers Grain Corporation Records, 1891-1989 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Producers Grain Corporation Records, 1891-1989 and undated
did.abstract: The collection consists of the business records of the Producers Grain Corporation between the years 1938-1983.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Producers Grain Corporation (PGC) was a regional grain marketing cooperative headquartered in Amarillo, Texas. It was organized by twenty-nine country elevators in April 1938. It opened international trade markets for the Great Plains sorghum production primarily to Japan (Zen Koren) and Mexico (Conasupo) during the 1950's and 1960's. PGC collected grain from Nebraska, Texas, Oklahoma, Colorado, Kansas, Arizona, and New Mexico. It had corporate operations in Lubbock, Fort Worth, Plainview, Corpus Christi, Texas and Colton, California. Feed mill operations beginning in 1945 served the ranchers and farmers of West Texas, western Oklahoma, New Mexico, Colorado, and Kansas. The company celebrated its 50th anniversary in 1988. After financial difficulties in the early 1980's, PGC sold to Agri Industries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of mainly business records between the years 1938-1983. Business records include correspondence, financial material, legal material, client records, as well as documents pertaining to the sale and settlement of PGC. A small portion of the collection contains photographs, slides and printed material. 18 films were transferred to the Audio/Visual department.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in the following series:

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.p: Producers Grain Corporation Records, 1891-1989 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas
